commentBody:
With Reince Priebus and Stephen Bannon working directly under him, Trump might be able to ward off attacks from both the establishment and the fringe of his adoptive party. If he intends to enact liberal compromises, this type of protection would be crucial.

Just saying. Could be that or the exact opposite. We'll find out.

I think there is at least a possibility that Trump plans to be rhetorically and socially provocative, but to govern as a pragmatist. Any other pathway will lead to disaster, so I certainly HOPE this is the case.

In that case, the decision to pull both extremes of the party under his wing, and under close supervision, could be seen as an effort to maintain control over them.
